page.title: 05WISTON MILL,NAYLAND,SUFFOLK
page.content: Wiston Mill comprises an 18th Century Water Mill and Mill House.It was converted into its present form in the late 1920's,the present house being formed from three Tudor cottages,and part of the ground and first floor of the Water Mill itself.The Mill House is mainly built of part brick and part stud and plaster with a tiled roof, whilst the Mill itself is partly brick,but largely of painted weatherboarding with a slated roof. There is a good deal of the original machinery still in the barn,although the water wheel itself has now almost disappeared.The Mill stands next to the River Stour,the Mill stream running beneath it into the Mill lade,with further sluice gates going off into the Mill Pool.This property is for sale,offers being invited in the region of Â£240,000 freehold.
